intro: Echium viridiargenteum, commonly known as the silverleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which gives it its common name, and its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae, known for its hairy stems and showy flowers.
